articles.title: Iron accumulation drives fibrosis, senescence and the senescence-associated secretory phenotype - Nature.com
articles.description: Iron is shown to have a central role in senescence, both by triggering senescence and through its accumulation in senescent cells, which is driving the senescence-associated secretory phenotype and, in turn, promotes fibrogenesis.
